intro: Diphyes tenella, commonly known as the slender bladdernut, is a deciduous shrub native to North America. It belongs to the family Hippocastanaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive, inflated fruits that split open to release seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
